stems.BSC: (to be/manifest) a two-dimensional shape or outline form — [both the shape and the entity manifesting that shape]
stems.CTE: (to be) the entity manifesting a particular 2-D shape or outline form
stems.CSV: (to be/manifest) a two-dimensional shape or outline form
stems.OBJ: (to be) the background or 'negative space' behind a 2-dimensional shape or outline form

stems: (to be a) figure (reminiscent of something) based on shape/form
notes: Associated Affix: SHP

stems: (to be/manifest a) two-dimensional contour, pattern, or outline as a representation/model for something
(to be/manifest a) three-dimensional contour, pattern, or outline as a representation/model for something

stems.BSC: (to be/manifest) a two-dimensional (quasi-)overlying simple visual surface design/pattern (= repetitive visual design)— [both the design/pattern and the entity manifesting such]
stems.CTE: (to be) something manifesting a 2-D overlying simple visual surface pattern
stems.CSV: (to be) a 2-D (quasi-)overlying simple visual surface pattern
stems.OBJ: (to be) the background upon or over which a 2-dimensional overlying design/pattern appears

stems: (to be/manifest) a two-dimensional (quasi-)overlying complex/multi-faced visual surface pattern (= complex repetitive visual design)
(to be/manifest a) two-dimensional (quasi-)overlying visual surface texture (= repetitive visual-tactile design)
notes: Affix: PAT

stems.BSC: (be) an open-ended (quasi-)linear outline shape (i.e. for describing the outline shape of any visual or tactile object/entity), e.g., an arc, a straight line, an S-shape, a V-shape, a squiggly line, etc.
stems.CTE: (be) the state of having a particular (quasi-)linear outline shape
stems.CSV: (be) the act of discerning/observing/perceiving a (quasi-)linear outline shape
stems.OBJ: (be) an object/entity which manifests the particular (quasi-)linear outline shape

stems: (be) the (quasi-)planar extension (in 3-dimensional space) of the Stem 1 linear shape, e.g., a hemisphere shape based on the Stem-1 linear shape of an arc, or a notch- or wedge-shaped indentation based on the  Stem-1 linear shape of a V-shape.

(be) the 'negative' space delineated by a (quasi-)linear outline shape, e.g., the pointed area of one's plane of vision created as the negative space set off by something in the foreground having a V-shaped outline.

notes: The English names given each shape are, in many cases, rather stilted given the absence of concise nomenclature being available. Note also that the directional orientation of the shape as shown is arbitrary and irrelevant.

stems.BSC: (be) a closed (quasi-)linear outline shape (i.e. for describing the outline shape of any visual or tactile object/entity)
stems.CTE: (be) the state of having a particular closed (quasi-)linear outline shape
stems.CSV: (be) the act of discerning/observing/perceiving a closed (quasi-)linear outline shape
stems.OBJ: (be) an object/entity which manifests the particular closed (quasi-)linear outline shape

stems: (be) a (quasi-)planar object/entity whose edge(s) constitute the Stem 1 closed linear shape, e.g., a cookie in the shape of a circle, or a stop-sign in the shape of an octagon.

(be) the background 'negative' space delineated by a closed (quasi-)linear outline shape, e.g., the area of one's plane of vision with a 'hole' in it, created as the negative space set off by something in the foreground having a closed-linear outline.

stems.BSC: (be) a solid three-dimensional outline form/shape, as determined by the holistic structure of its planar surfaces (e.g., a cube, a sphere, a pyramidal shape, etc.)
stems.CTE: (be) the state of having a particular three-dimensional outline form/shape
stems.CSV: (be) the act of discerning/observing/perceiving a three-dimensional outline form/shape
stems.OBJ: (be) an object/entity which manifests the particular three-dimensional outline form/shape

stems: [same as stem 1 except that the 3-dimensional form is hollow, consisting only of the collection of surface planes or geodesic/curved plane]

(be) a a three-dimensional lattice form/shape, as determined by the collective structure/lattice formed by its linear edges (e.g., a cube-shaped lattice formed from eight linear elements of equal length whose end-points are connected to two others at right angles, a lattice in the form of a sphere, a pyramid-shaped lattice, etc.)

notes: [i.e., same as ovoid except that width-wise cross-section is an oval or ellipse rather than a circle]
[for a polygon with a specific number of sides more than eight, concatenate a number stem with either COMPOSITIVE format or UTILITATIVE format into this root]
[for a polyhedron with a specific number of faces more than eight, concatenate a number stem with either COMPOSITIVE format or UTILITATIVE format into this root]
i.e., shaped like a Life-Saver piece of candy
i.e., concave lens-shaped
i.e., convex lens-shaped
